maria.name: Maria Tribe
maria.subheading: Forest-dwelling tribe known for strong community life and traditional dances
maria.description:
About the Maria Tribe

• Lives mainly in the forest regions of Abujmarh, Bastar
• Known for strong community life and simple living
• Deeply connected to nature and forest resources

Daily Life
• Farming, hunting, fishing, and forest produce collection
• Houses made from mud, wood, and thatched roofs
• Community decisions are taken together

Culture & Traditions
• Famous for the Bison Horn Dance
• Traditional drums and folk music
• Festivals celebrated with rituals and group dances

Food Habits
• Rice as staple food
• Chapda (red ant chutney)
• Mahua flowers and forest vegetables

sections.title: Daily Life
sections.details: The daily life of the Maria tribe is deeply connected to the forest, with **farming** and **gathering** being central activities.

sections.title: Food Habits
sections.details: Their diet consists mainly of **rice**, **millets**, and naturally available forest produce.

sections.title: Dance & Music
sections.details: Music and dance, especially the **Bison Horn Dance**, are integral to their cultural expression.

gond.name: Gond Tribe
gond.subheading: One of India’s largest tribes famous for art and nature worship
gond.description:
About the Gond Tribe

• One of the largest tribal communities in India
• Found across Bastar and southern Chhattisgarh
• Rich history of art, folklore, and traditions

Beliefs & Lifestyle
• Worship nature, trees, animals, rivers, and hills
• Farming and forest collection are main occupations
• Art is an important part of daily life

Art & Culture
• Famous for Gond paintings using dots and lines
• Paintings show animals, trees, and village life
• Folk songs are sung during festivals and farming

Festivals & Food
• Madai, Hareli, and Polam Pandum festivals
• Rice, mahua, forest fruits, and vegetables

sections.title: About
sections.details: The **Gond tribe** is one of the largest and most historically significant tribal groups in India.

data.title: One of the largest tribes in India
data.description: One of the largest tribes in India

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details: They hold a strong belief in the **sacredness of nature**, worshipping trees, rivers, and mountains.

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details: Gond art is world-renowned for its intricate **patterns** and **vibrant colors**, depicting stories of nature.

data.title: Gond paintings made with dots and lines
data.description: Gond paintings made with dots and lines

data.title: Paintings show animals and daily life
data.description: Paintings show animals and daily life

sections.title: Food
sections.details: Staple foods include **rice** and **mahua**, supplemented by seasonal forest fruits.

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details: They celebrate various festivals like **Madai** and **Hareli** to honor their deities and the harvest.

baiga.name: Baiga Tribe
baiga.subheading: Forest-dwelling tribe known as the protectors of nature
baiga.description:
About the Baiga Tribe

• Primitive tribal group of Central India
• Mostly found in Kawardha and forest regions
• Known for deep connection with forests

Beliefs & Lifestyle
• Believe forests are sacred
• Practice shifting cultivation (Bewar)
• Traditional healers using forest herbs

Art & Culture
• Tattoo art (Godna) is popular
• Folk dances during festivals

Festivals & Food
• Hareli and Madai festivals
• Eat kodo, kutki, forest roots

sections.title: About
sections.details: Baigas are known as guardians of forests.

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details: Nature worship is central.

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details: Famous for tattoo art.

sections.title: Food
sections.details: Forest-based simple diet.

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details: Celebrate seasonal festivals.

halba.name: Halba Tribe
halba.subheading: Agricultural tribe known for discipline and farming skills
halba.description:
• Found in Bastar region
• Primarily farmers
• Known for strong social organization

sections.title: About
sections.details: The **Halba tribe** is one of the most progressive and landed tribal communities, often serving as landlords and holding high social status.

data.title: Kabirpanthi Influence
data.description: Many follow the non-violent Kabir Panth

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details: While they worship Danteshwari Ma, a significant section follows **Kabir Panth**, abstaining from alcohol and meat.

data.title: Kabir Panth
data.description: Sect focusing on truth and simplicity

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details: Known for their unique **Halbi dialect**, which serves as the lingua franca of Bastar, and agricultural tools craftsmanship.

sections.title: Food
sections.details: Their cuisine is famous for **Poha** (flattened rice) and **Cheela**, often prepared with special variations.

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details: Major celebrations include **Hareli**, **Pola**, and **Diwali**, celebrated with agricultural significance.

bhatra.name: Bhatra Tribe
bhatra.description:
• Found in Bastar and Kondagaon
• Primarily farmers
• Known for simple lifestyle

sections.title: About
sections.details: The **Bhatra tribe** is known for their unique social stratification and talent in **tribal theater**.

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details: They worship **Mati Deo** (Earth God) and perform rituals for hunting and harvesting success.

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details: Famous for **Bhatra Nat**, a traditional tribal theater form involving storytelling and acting.

sections.title: Food
sections.details: Their diet includes rice, millets, and delicacies like **Chapda** (red ant chutney).

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details: They celebrate **Bali Parab** and **Mati Tihar** with great enthusiasm.

oraon.name: Oraon Tribe
oraon.subheading: Agricultural tribe known for Karma dance and vibrant festivals
oraon.description:
• Also known as Kurukh tribe
• Found in Jashpur, Surguja and northern Chhattisgarh
• Strong community traditions and agricultural lifestyle

sections.title: About
sections.details: The Oraon are famous for their **Dhumkuria** (Youth Dormitory) system and advanced community living.

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details: They follow the **Sarna** religion, worshipping nature in sacred groves, and honor **Dharmesh** (Sun God).

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details: Renowned for their **geometric wall paintings** and the rhythmic **Karma dance**.

sections.title: Food
sections.details: Staple food is rice and **Gondli**, often accompanied by **Handia** (rice beer) during festivals.

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details: Major festivals are **Sarhul** (Spring) and **Karma**, celebrating nature cycles.

binjhwar.name: Binjhwar Tribe
binjhwar.subheading: Agricultural tribal community of central Chhattisgarh
binjhwar.description:
• Found in Raigarh and surrounding districts
• Mainly farmers
• Preserve traditional customs

sections.title: About
sections.details: The **Binjhwar** tribe claims a connection to the Vindhya hills and holds the **arrow** (Tir) as a sacred symbol.

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details: They worship **Vindhyavasini Devi** and have unique marriage rituals where an arrow represents the groom.

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details: Skilled in making **bamboo articles**, mats, and fishing traps from forest materials.

sections.title: Food
sections.details: Their diet depends on rice and forest produce like **Tendu** and **Char**.

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details: They celebrate **Jwara** and **Bhojali**, involving the sprouting of wheat/barley.

kawar.name: Kawar Tribe
kawar.subheading: Tribal community known for farming and traditional governance
kawar.description:
• Found in Raigarh and Korba districts
• Agriculture main occupation
• Preserve tribal customs and rituals

sections.title: About
sections.details: The **Kawar tribe** traces their descent from the **Kauravas** of the Mahabharata and has a martial history.

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details: They strictly follow their clan rules and worship the sword as a symbol of their warrior past.

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details: Their artistic expression is seen in **wall paintings** during festivals and martial dance forms.

sections.title: Food
sections.details: Staple food is rice and pulses; many have adopted vegetarianism due to reform movements.

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details: Celebrations include **Hareli** and **Laruj Kaj**, a unique pig sacrifice festival (though declining).

korwa.name: Pahadi Korwa
korwa.subheading: Vulnerable hill tribe living traditionally with deep dependence on forests
korwa.description:
About the Pahadi Korwa Tribe

• Classified as a Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group (PVTG)
• Lives in hilly and forest areas of northern Chhattisgarh
• Very limited influence of modern lifestyle

Living Style
• Depends heavily on forests for survival
• Lives in small huts made from mud and bamboo
• Collects food from deep forest areas

Traditional Skills
• Archery and hunting skills
• Making tools from forest materials
• Strong knowledge of forest paths and nature

Food Sources
• Mahua collection
• Roots, tubers, and wild fruits

sections.title: About
sections.details: The **Pahadi Korwa** are a Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group, living in harmony with the deep forests.

sections.title: Living Style
sections.details: They live a simple life in **thatched huts**, relying entirely on the forest for their needs.

data.title: Small huts made from mud and bamboo
data.description: Small huts made from mud and bamboo

sections.title: Traditional Skills
sections.details: They are expert **archers** and skilled in making tools from bamboo and wood.

sections.title: Food Sources
sections.details: Their food sources are primarily **foraged** from the wild, including roots, tubers, and mahua.
